flow.descriptionCdata:
ec2a50f2-de78-4fcc-84c4-0d561e371aa8.018426b5-eafe-4d0a-ad18-742766a98c40.description=
Allows a user to select how they should be notified of the outcome of a flow, and shows them a message in that way.

Inputs\:
notifyData -  The message to notify the user of.
notifyMethod - The method of notification (file, email, display).
subject - This is a description of what the notification is about.
destination - for files, the file to write to, for emails the email to send to.
notificationServer - The server to send the notification through if any (for example, an email server).
serverPort - The port on the server to notify through.
from - The message originator, for example a from email address.

Responses\:
success - The user was notified.
failure - Notification failed.
ec2a50f2-de78-4fcc-84c4-0d561e371aa8.074dfc4d-a1d8-47b2-a057-35441251679b.description=
This gets the number of processors on the system

Inputs\:

host\:  the system to check
username\: the user to log into this system as
password\: the password to log in with
port - port number for connecting to the host
protocol - the protocol used to run the command (can be one of ssh, ROSH, GlobalShell, Telnet, RSH, local or WMI)
timeout - (optional, default 90 seconds) time in milliseconds to wait for the command to complete
pty - (true, false) whether to use pty
privateKeyFile - The absolute path to the private key file for remote host.
sasHost - the host we want to run the ROSH command on
sasHostUsername - the username used to run the ROSH command on sasHost
usernamePrompt - the prompt that when seen should send the username
passwordPrompt - the prompt that when given should send the password

Responses\:

success\: the data was obtained
failure\: the data could not be obtained

Results\: 

the number of processors
ec2a50f2-de78-4fcc-84c4-0d561e371aa8.076d724b-eda1-4ea9-9db7-1c7075bdc030.description=
This gets the extended information from iostat using iostat -x.  Two data samples are gathered, the first one shows system averages since the last boot and the second shows the current point in time.


Inputs\:

host - hostname or ip address
port - port number for connecting to the host
username - username to connect as
password - password
protocol - the protocol used to run the command (can be one of ssh, ROSH, GlobalShell, Telnet, RSH, local or WMI)
timeout - (optional, default 90 seconds) time in milliseconds to wait for the command to complete
pty - (true, false) whether to use pty
privateKeyFile - The absolute path to the private key file for remote host.
sasHost - the host we want to run the ROSH command on
sasHostUsername - the username used to run the ROSH command on sasHost
usernamePrompt - the prompt that when seen should send the username
passwordPrompt - the prompt that when given should send the password

Responses\:

success\: the file was deleted
failure\: the file was not deleted

Result\:

the iostat return data

Notice\:
This operation requires the sysstat package to be installed on the Linux machine.
ec2a50f2-de78-4fcc-84c4-0d561e371aa8.0a0033e9-8aab-4d97-ba91-8297319ec5b1.transition.description=Successfully pinged ${host} ec2a50f2-de78-4fcc-84c4-0d561e371aa8.0ba80887-06f4-4744-85c2-7619282b7c46.transition.description=Unable to get memory information from ${host}\: ${error} ec2a50f2-de78-4fcc-84c4-0d561e371aa8.0dd587c5-f335-440e-a6dd-0d5d4e9a8f6c.prompt=Username\: ec2a50f2-de78-4fcc-84c4-0d561e371aa8.0f1ef875-452d-4276-8932-a297940f3592.transition.description=iostat information obtained from ${host} ec2a50f2-de78-4fcc-84c4-0d561e371aa8.12a8fef8-2295-4711-9bad-a2f04d89aaf7.prompt=Enter a value for targetHost ec2a50f2-de78-4fcc-84c4-0d561e371aa8.14174e2b-4c1d-4e12-8c9b-9d2338553c40.transition.description=System is running ${osname} ec2a50f2-de78-4fcc-84c4-0d561e371aa8.1dc4aba6-4fa9-4487-9350-734cba2a219e.prompt=Password\: ec2a50f2-de78-4fcc-84c4-0d561e371aa8.1ee05143-84f0-4a94-ae66-8adc0fdca8bf.prompt=First Value\: ec2a50f2-de78-4fcc-84c4-0d561e371aa8.1f0ac9bf-fef5-4175-8e62-032c9da18766.description=
This gets the amount of uptime (in minutes).

Inputs\:

host\:  the system to check
username\: the user to log into this system as
password\: the password to log in with
port - port number for connecting to the host
protocol - the protocol used to run the command (can be one of ssh, ROSH, GlobalShell, Telnet, RSH, local or WMI)
timeout - (optional, default 90 seconds) time in milliseconds to wait for the command to complete
pty - (true, false) whether to use pty
privateKeyFile - The absolute path to the private key file for remote host.
sasHost - the host we want to run the ROSH command on
sasHostUsername - the username used to run the ROSH command on sasHost
usernamePrompt - the prompt that when seen should send the username
passwordPrompt - the prompt that when given should send the password

Responses\:

success\: the data was obtained
failure\: the data could not be obtained

Result\: 

number of minutes the system has been up
ec2a50f2-de78-4fcc-84c4-0d561e371aa8.246c54a9-ab55-4fe3-9eac-835189db1471.transition.description=Less than ${thresholdMinutes} ec2a50f2-de78-4fcc-84c4-0d561e371aa8.2996b55f-64bf-4a66-8546-7b0751a0a0e5.transition.description=Obtained network information from ${host} ec2a50f2-de78-4fcc-84c4-0d561e371aa8.2c2813f7-28d6-4f49-8232-08c7b41a2693.description=
This gets the list of currently running process


Inputs\:

host\:  the system to check
username\: the user to log into this system as
password\: the password to log in with
port - port number for connecting to the host
protocol - the protocol used to run the command (can be one of ssh, ROSH, GlobalShell, Telnet, RSH, local or WMI)
timeout - (optional, default 90 seconds) time in milliseconds to wait for the command to complete
pty - (true, false) whether to use pty
privateKeyFile - The absolute path to the private key file for remote host.
sasHost - the host we want to run the ROSH command on
sasHostUsername - the username used to run the ROSH command on sasHost
usernamePrompt - the prompt that when seen should send the username
passwordPrompt - the prompt that when given should send the password

Responses\:

success\: the data was obtained
failure\: the data could not be obtained

Result\:

the process list using the long output format
ec2a50f2-de78-4fcc-84c4-0d561e371aa8.3098f43d-5be0-4bf6-965e-1815f1cc9a05.prompt=Port\: ec2a50f2-de78-4fcc-84c4-0d561e371aa8.32fd2aad-774d-4f63-abeb-4237ffd60a9e.prompt=Notification option\: ec2a50f2-de78-4fcc-84c4-0d561e371aa8.38744f1b-dd20-42c8-85f3-66f71e80368e.prompt=SasHostUsername\: ec2a50f2-de78-4fcc-84c4-0d561e371aa8.39a94ac1-4772-4fbc-9646-3c788c7897bb.prompt=Username\: ec2a50f2-de78-4fcc-84c4-0d561e371aa8.463d9e89-d98d-412d-988e-5ca85b00d187.description=
Checks if a number or word is greater than or equal to another number or word. Word comparison is case-sensitive in alphabetical order.

Inputs\:
value1 - the first value.
value2 - the second value.

Returns\:
value1 <\= value2

Responses\:
success - The boolean operation was evaluated to true.
failure - Something went wrong or the boolean operation returned false.
ec2a50f2-de78-4fcc-84c4-0d561e371aa8.47642a8b-0920-4d47-a1e2-31a5cdb344c6.transition.description=Unable to retrieve log messages from ${logfilename} on ${host}\: ${error} ec2a50f2-de78-4fcc-84c4-0d561e371aa8.47932cc3-9258-4842-ae06-562659e798ba.prompt=SasHost\: ec2a50f2-de78-4fcc-84c4-0d561e371aa8.54162fb9-5c2d-4812-92fd-4e57630e5e31.description=
This will retrieve the last messages from a log file.

Inputs\:

host\:  the system to check
username\: the user to log into this system as
password\: the password to log in with
filename\: the log file name to check
port - port number for connecting to the host
protocol - the protocol used to run the command (can be one of ssh, ROSH, GlobalShell, Telnet, RSH, local or WMI)
timeout - (optional, default 90 seconds) time in milliseconds to wait for the command to complete
pty - (true, false) whether to use pty
privateKeyFile - The absolute path to the private key file for remote host.
sasHost - the host we want to run the ROSH command on
sasHostUsername - the username used to run the ROSH command on sasHost
usernamePrompt - the prompt that when seen should send the username
passwordPrompt - the prompt that when given should send the password
Responses\:

success\: the data was obtained
failure\: the data could not be obtained

Result\:

The last messages (up to 10).
ec2a50f2-de78-4fcc-84c4-0d561e371aa8.58d79eee-e5d9-419a-9d0b-2c9f21f6a32c.description=
This gets the operating system name.

Inputs\:

host\:  the system to check
username\: the user to log into this system as
password\: the password to log in with
port - port number for connecting to the host
protocol - the protocol used to run the command (can be one of ssh, ROSH, GlobalShell, Telnet, RSH, local or WMI)
timeout - (optional, default 90 seconds) time in milliseconds to wait for the command to complete
pty - (true, false) whether to use pty
privateKeyFile - The absolute path to the private key file for remote host.
sasHost - the host we want to run the ROSH command on
sasHostUsername - the username used to run the ROSH command on sasHost
usernamePrompt - the prompt that when seen should send the username
passwordPrompt - the prompt that when given should send the password

Responses\:

success\: the data was obtained
failure\: the data could not be obtained

Result\:

the OS name (uname return information)
ec2a50f2-de78-4fcc-84c4-0d561e371aa8.5bddafeb-0808-49fd-933a-937202f9432d.description=
Pings the requested machine from the Web Services machine

Input Parameters\:
host - hostname or IP address of the target host

Responses\:
passed - a successful connection was made
failure - unable to make a connection
host not found - could not resolve hostname to a valid IP address

Extra Results\:
output - raw output of the results
addresses - list of addresses returned from DNS
aliases - list of aliases returned from DNS
addresspinged - actual IP address pinged
% Packet Loss - The percentage of packets that now ping reply was received for.
Average Latency - The average ping response time in milliseconds.
max latency - The maximum response time of all the pings (in milliseconds).
min latency - the minimum number of milliseconds it took to receive a ping response.
ec2a50f2-de78-4fcc-84c4-0d561e371aa8.60348d9f-502f-40d6-91f9-534d8f745e55.prompt=UsernamePrompt\: ec2a50f2-de78-4fcc-84c4-0d561e371aa8.62f82dfb-dceb-4e69-a63b-7ed229cd2e2d.transition.description=Log messages retrieved ec2a50f2-de78-4fcc-84c4-0d561e371aa8.68c951ea-308b-49cc-8b8d-0535c6c2a9ce.transition.description=Unable to get iostat information from ${host}\: ${error} ec2a50f2-de78-4fcc-84c4-0d561e371aa8.6b421a87-6d44-4d3b-908e-c2ee766ce1a9.description=
Accepts the username and password for the Red Hat machine.

Inputs\:
username - User name for the host.
password - Password for the username.

Responses\:
success - Username and password accepted successfully.
ec2a50f2-de78-4fcc-84c4-0d561e371aa8.6b74cde2-2f61-4fc3-b48b-0b3b1c7df944.description=
Executes an Expression (e.x value1 \=\= value2)

Input Parameters\:
value1 - the value to threshold with
value2 - the threshold to threshold against
operator - (\=\=, \!\=,  >, >\=, <, <\=) the type of threshold
truestring - string to push into returnResult if the threshold has not been passed
falsestring - string to push into the returnResult if the threshold has been passed

Responses\:
success - the expression is true
failure - the expression is false
ec2a50f2-de78-4fcc-84c4-0d561e371aa8.79882b1a-bcd9-49c0-8a09-db7ecc30eb16.transition.description=Failed to get file system information from ${host}\: ${error} ec2a50f2-de78-4fcc-84c4-0d561e371aa8.7c15eb99-9b74-4c78-8238-67e87d507ef3.transition.description=Load averages are ${oneMinute} ${fiveMinute} ${fifteenMinute} ec2a50f2-de78-4fcc-84c4-0d561e371aa8.80b42630-7eca-440c-bfb1-328752e1e444.description=
This retrieves memory metrics using top.  

Inputs\:

host\:  the system to check
username\: the user to log into this system as
password\: the password to log in with
port - port number for connecting to the host
protocol - the protocol used to run the command (can be one of ssh, ROSH, GlobalShell, Telnet, RSH, local or WMI)
timeout - (optional, default 90 seconds) time in milliseconds to wait for the command to complete
pty - (true, false) whether to use pty
privateKeyFile - The absolute path to the private key file for remote host.
sasHost - the host we want to run the ROSH command on
sasHostUsername - the username used to run the ROSH command on sasHost
usernamePrompt - the prompt that when seen should send the username
passwordPrompt - the prompt that when given should send the password
Responses\:

success\: the data was obtained
failure\: the data could not be obtained

Result\:

the return code from the vmstat command

Extra Results\:

activeMemory - the number of megabytes of active memory.
bufferMemory - the number of megabytes of buffer memory.
freeMemory - the number of megabytes of unused memory.
freeSwap - the number of megabytes of unused swap.
inactiveMemory - the number of megabytes of inactive memory.
sharedMemory - the number of megabytes of shared memory.
swapCache - the number of megabytes of swap cache.
totalMemory	- the number of megabytes of total memory.
totalSwap - the number of megabytes of total swap space.
usedMemory - the number of megabytes of used memory.
usedSwap - the number of megabytes of used swap.
ec2a50f2-de78-4fcc-84c4-0d561e371aa8.85850b39-348a-4d23-abbd-a7975a34d848.transition.description=Unable to check log messages on ${host}\: ${error} ec2a50f2-de78-4fcc-84c4-0d561e371aa8.88b15ae9-9edf-4e1e-b2a9-d134895bc4b9.transition.description=Failed to retrieve Red Hat version. ec2a50f2-de78-4fcc-84c4-0d561e371aa8.8953379e-2d26-45f6-9f47-aa5c3048ef79.transition.description=Failed to get processor count from ${host}\: ${error} ec2a50f2-de78-4fcc-84c4-0d561e371aa8.8aa6f3e5-bc36-4fd4-bef4-81763ac87bf3.transition.description=Failed to get uptime information from ${host}\: ${error} ec2a50f2-de78-4fcc-84c4-0d561e371aa8.8b61c572-fd55-4f16-8a4d-360ef50596cd.prompt=Notification Method\: ec2a50f2-de78-4fcc-84c4-0d561e371aa8.941c6977-2add-456d-b00b-c56d5b2b75a1.transition.description=Read process list ec2a50f2-de78-4fcc-84c4-0d561e371aa8.96696d24-ee02-41fa-bb8e-de83d82e69a3.transition.description=iostat information obtained from ${host} ec2a50f2-de78-4fcc-84c4-0d561e371aa8.977ff8e0-d89e-4fdf-b933-c94e58a162ce.transition.description=Failed to get OS information from ${host}\: ${error} ec2a50f2-de78-4fcc-84c4-0d561e371aa8.9d3dd723-ec86-492d-b733-68178befa4b7.description=
This gets the extended information from iostat using iostat -x.  Two data samples are gathered, the first one shows system averages since the last boot and the second shows the current point in time.


Inputs\:

host - hostname or ip address
port - port number for connecting to the host
username - username to connect as
password - password
protocol - the protocol used to run the command (can be one of ssh, ROSH, GlobalShell, Telnet, RSH, local or WMI)
timeout - (optional, default 90 seconds) time in milliseconds to wait for the command to complete
pty - (true, false) whether to use pty
privateKeyFile - The absolute path to the private key file for remote host.
sasHost - the host we want to run the ROSH command on
sasHostUsername - the username used to run the ROSH command on sasHost
usernamePrompt - the prompt that when seen should send the username
passwordPrompt - the prompt that when given should send the password

Responses\:

success\: the file was deleted
failure\: the file was not deleted

Result\:

the iostat return data

Notice\:
This operation requires the sysstat package to be installed on the Linux machine.
ec2a50f2-de78-4fcc-84c4-0d561e371aa8.a3f161a3-fba9-4bfa-b6b2-303dfbe5960f.description=
This gets the list of file systems on the machine

Inputs\:

host - hostname or ip address
port - port number for connecting to the host
username - username to connect as
password - password
protocol - the protocol used to run the command (can be one of ssh, ROSH, GlobalShell, Telnet, RSH, local or WMI)
timeout - (optional, default 90 seconds) time in milliseconds to wait for the command to complete
pty - (true, false) whether to use pty
privateKeyFile - The absolute path to the private key file for remote host.
sasHost - the host we want to run the ROSH command on
sasHostUsername - the username used to run the ROSH command on sasHost
usernamePrompt - the prompt that when seen should send the username
passwordPrompt - the prompt that when given should send the password
Responses\:

success\: the data was obtained
failure\: the data could not be obtained

Result\:

A table of file system names and percent full sorted with the most full system first.  Note that the percent full is the first column in the table and the name is the second column.  The first row of the table are column headers.  For example\:

Use%     Mounted
66%       /
16%       /boot
0%         /dev/shm
ec2a50f2-de78-4fcc-84c4-0d561e371aa8.a4e88ae8-9ec1-48f1-b536-afbf9b16925a.transition.description=RedHat Version retrieved ec2a50f2-de78-4fcc-84c4-0d561e371aa8.ad2d1b29-6d2a-4b3f-b49c-2223528cd1b9.prompt=PasswordPrompt\: ec2a50f2-de78-4fcc-84c4-0d561e371aa8.ae33aa99-edd5-4781-b6d8-cf18668bb903.transition.description=${host} has ${freeMemory} MB of free memory ec2a50f2-de78-4fcc-84c4-0d561e371aa8.b803a99b-11d2-451f-969c-f820553cd14f.transition.description=Last message in ${filename} was ${minutes} minutes ago ec2a50f2-de78-4fcc-84c4-0d561e371aa8.bd458c28-4b00-4b75-957c-3a5a6a73fd26.transition.description=Red Hat version older than 5. ec2a50f2-de78-4fcc-84c4-0d561e371aa8.c6cfa930-8bda-4742-af93-e94386788d88.description=
Checks to see if a string matches a specific rule.

Inputs\:
matchType - The type of match to perform.
toMatch - The string to check if matches another string.
matchTo - The string to match against.
ignoreCase - Boolean value for whether or not to ignore case during match.

Responses\:
success - The String matched.
failure - The string did not match, or something went wrong.
ec2a50f2-de78-4fcc-84c4-0d561e371aa8.c7991f63-9124-4c96-8073-dc6c6bb679a5.transition.description=More than ${thresholdMinutes} ec2a50f2-de78-4fcc-84c4-0d561e371aa8.caee42ec-365e-4d5f-847c-ddb02d16d7c3.prompt=Pty\: ec2a50f2-de78-4fcc-84c4-0d561e371aa8.cbecc8cf-5559-433d-a1df-77031c432c58.description=
This gets the load averages from the uptime command

Inputs\:

host\:  the system to check
username\: the user to log into this system as
password\: the password to log in with
port - port number for connecting to the host
protocol - the protocol used to run the command (can be one of ssh, ROSH, GlobalShell, Telnet, RSH, local or WMI)
timeout - (optional, default 90 seconds) time in milliseconds to wait for the command to complete
pty - (true, false) whether to use pty
privateKeyFile - The absolute path to the private key file for remote host.
sasHost - the host we want to run the ROSH command on
sasHostUsername - the username used to run the ROSH command on sasHost
usernamePrompt - the prompt that when seen should send the username
passwordPrompt - the prompt that when given should send the password


Responses\:

success\: the data was obtained
failure\: the data could not be obtained

Result\:

the uptime return code

Extra Results\:

oneMinute\: the one minute load average
fiveMinute\: the five minute load average
fifteenMinute\: the fifteen minute load average
ec2a50f2-de78-4fcc-84c4-0d561e371aa8.cc6c6cde-dee2-420f-9969-7057a800acbd.description=
This determines how long it has been since the last log message.  It first looks in the log file that is passed into the repair and if that file is empty it then appends a .0 to look at the last rolled log.

Inputs\:

host - the host to run on.
username - user for host
password - password for username.
filename - the log file to check.
port - port number for connecting to the host
protocol - the protocol used to run the command (can be one of ssh, ROSH, GlobalShell, Telnet, RSH, local or WMI)
timeout - (optional, default 90 seconds) time in milliseconds to wait for the command to complete
pty - (true, false) whether to use pty
privateKeyFile - The absolute path to the private key file for remote host.
sasHost - the host we want to run the ROSH command on
sasHostUsername - the username used to run the ROSH command on sasHost
usernamePrompt - the prompt that when seen should send the username
passwordPrompt - the prompt that when given should send the password


Result\: number of minutes since the last log message

Responses\: 
   success if a message was found and a time determined
   failure if there was an access problem (incorrect hostname, username or password) or there were no log messages
ec2a50f2-de78-4fcc-84c4-0d561e371aa8.cfb4e50b-c6b9-4200-8aec-b56085dec9e7.transition.description=Unable to get load averages from ${host}\: ${error} ec2a50f2-de78-4fcc-84c4-0d561e371aa8.db1134ec-5eea-408f-a696-d1b4fffcab8f.prompt=Timeout\: ec2a50f2-de78-4fcc-84c4-0d561e371aa8.db4b4068-c639-4af3-b3f1-fc13d5bbbc47.transition.description=${host} has ${numProcs} processor(s) ec2a50f2-de78-4fcc-84c4-0d561e371aa8.dc989cb1-40f0-4b5a-aca1-7d4a6cc1cc86.prompt=Password\: ec2a50f2-de78-4fcc-84c4-0d561e371aa8.description=
This performs a health check on a Red Hat server.  It looks at\:

Network connectivity
Uptime
Gets OS information
Checks for and displays recent error log messages
Checks load average versus number of processors
Checks free memory and looks for swapping activity
Verifies vital processes are running
Checks to see if there is sufficient free disk space and looks at disk performance

When all the information is gathered a comprehensive report is generated with any warning information at the top of the report. Gathering IO statistics requires the iostat command to be available (install sysstat package). 

Inputs\:
host - the host to run on.
username - user for host. Do not specify username for localhost.
password - password for username. Do not specify password for localhost.
notification - notification method.
port - port number for connecting to the host
protocol - the protocol used to run the command (can be one of ssh, ROSH, GlobalShell, Telnet, RSH, local or WMI)
timeout - (optional, default 90 seconds) time in milliseconds to wait for the command to complete
pty - (true, false) whether to use pty
privateKeyFile - The absolute path to the private key file for remote host.
sasHost - the host we want to run the ROSH command on
sasHostUsername - the username used to run the ROSH command on sasHost
usernamePrompt - the prompt that when seen should send the username
passwordPrompt - the prompt that when given should send the password
time - time to check machine uptime

Responses\:
success - the operation succeeded.
failure - unable to complete operation.

checks a system for network errors

Inputs\:

host - the system to check
username - the user to log into this system as
password - the password to log in with
port - port number for connecting to the host
protocol - the protocol used to run the command (can be one of ssh, ROSH, GlobalShell, Telnet, RSH, local or WMI)
timeout - (optional, default 90 seconds) time in milliseconds to wait for the command to complete
pty - (true, false) whether to use pty
privateKeyFile - The absolute path to the private key file for remote host.
sasHost - the host we want to run the ROSH command on
sasHostUsername - the username used to run the ROSH command on sasHost
usernamePrompt - the prompt that when seen should send the username
passwordPrompt - the prompt that when given should send the password

Responses\:

success\: the data was obtained
failure\: the data could not be obtained

Result\:

Any error data - populated by the scriptlet
